item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Svader – Create GPU-rendered Svelte components (53 points | 12 comments)
2. I made a free Figma library packed with components for fast prototyping (58 points | 16 comments)
3. YouTube quietly made some of its web embeds worse, including ours (60 points | 22 comments)
4. Asynchronous Rust on Cortex-M Microcontrollers (2023) (16 points | 5 comments)
5. Byte Latent Transformer: Patches Scale Better Than Tokens (100 points | 23 comments)
6. What Is Entropy? A Measure of Just How Little We Know (70 points | 21 comments)
7. The Saga of the Color Brown in the Early Years of the PC (2023) (5 points | 3 comments)
8. Fujitsu's Monaka CPU: ARMv9, SVE2, and 3D Stacking (11 points | 4 comments)
9. Fern (YC W23) Is Hiring a Senior Front End Engineer ( | hide)
10. Sharing new research, models, and datasets from Meta FAIR (263 points | 44 comments)
11. Energy-Harvesting Electronic Holiday Card 2024 (99 points | 9 comments)
12. Why conversations are better with four people (24 points | 12 comments)
13. Luon programming language (157 points | 71 comments)
14. Ilya Sutskever NeurIPS talk [video] (56 points | 22 comments)
15. Show HN: Performant intracontinental public transport routing in Rust (103 points | 16 comments)
16. Study reveals mammoth as key food source for ancient Americans (9 points | 3 comments)
17. Graphene Interconnects Aim to Give Moore's Law New Life (31 points | 11 comments)
18. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (164 points | 34 comments)
19. Making my first robot as a software engineer (294 points | 53 comments)
20. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (202 points | 52 comments)
21. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (173 points | 19 comments)
22. My PhD advisor rewrote himself in bash (2010) (185 points | 76 comments)
23. Donald Bitzer has died (189 points | 19 comments)
24. Idiomatic Errors in Clojure (58 points | 20 comments)
25. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (397 points | 194 comments)
26. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (204 points | 137 comments)
27. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (172 points | 26 comments)
28. The science of routing print orders (13 points | 4 comments)
29. OpenAI whistleblower found dead in San Francisco apartment (744 points | 272 comments)
30. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (127 points | 41 comments)
